intro: Trixapias capillacea, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in winter. It has a succulent, fleshy stem and leaves that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. Trixapias capillacea is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
